channel.title: Dietrich Ayala
channel.description: Internet freedom, the web and Mozilla.

item.title: Word HTML Cleaner for PHP
item.description: "This utility strips proprietary Microsoft tags and artefacts from Word HTML documents, leaving basic formatting and typographic entities intact. Curled quotes and em and en dashes should come through fine, as long as they existed in the original Word document: run Autoformat to be sure."Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: How to Implement Relax NG
item.description:
James Clark: "I have written a paper describing one possible algorithm for implementing

RELAX NG validation. This is the algorithm used by Jing, which I believe

has also been adopted by MSV."Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Semantic Web How-to
item.description: Step-by-step instructions showing you how to add your pages to the "semantic web." Basically is how to add RDF to every page, and to your site.Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Quote from Nicholas Lehuen on xml-dev
item.description: "Building for the future does not necessarely mean we must stick to the past."Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: What is Demeter?
item.description:
"An important concept of Demeter is to split software

into at least two parts: The first part defines the objects.

The second part defines the operations. The goal of

Demeter is to maintain a loose coupling between the

objects and the operations, so that one can

make modifications to either without serious impact

on the other. This cuts down significantly on

maintenance time."Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Elliotte Harold slides from XMLOne, London 2002
item.description:
"- Advanced XML Programming

  • Mastering XML Schemas

  • Namespaces

The Advanced XML Programming all-day tutorial contained lots of new material on DOM Level 3, XPath 2.0, and XSLT 2.0 that I hadn't delivered previously. There are also some new notes in the namesapces talk on how namespaces work in SAX, DOM, and JDOM."Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Nicholas Lehuen on Schema Validation (xml-dev)
item.description:
"I still don't understand why validation is not performed in a SAX filter rather than in parsers. Parsers like Xerces have dramatically grown in size and have performance problem due to the fact that validation is built in the parser.

To me, parsing and validating are two different activities. They may have

been integrated for performance reasons of the parsing+validation pipeline,

but I'd still like to have a clean, high performance parsing pipeline in

which I could plugin any kind of validators (eg. Sun MSV).

Take the bug that causes Xerces 2 to dereference and parse schemas even if

validation is disabled for example. I hope it has been fixed since, but if Xerces 2 was not mixing a lot of APIs and technologies (parsing, validating, building a DTD specific DOMs, etc.) in a monolithic way, the bug would have never appeared in the first place."Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Dare Obasanjo K5 Article: What do you know about XML and Databases?
item.description:
dated oct, 2001.

what is a native xml database?

briefly reviews different solutions.Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Article: Building Cross Platform GUI Apps With PHP-GTK
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: SIXDML Specification
item.description:
Dare Obasanjo, author:

"This document outlines a data manipulation language for XML repositories that enables users to perform data management tasks such as creation and deletion of indices, collections and documents. The language proposed also provides the ability to perform queries, transformations and updates on the documents in the XML repository either singly or across an entire collection."Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: In the Beginning...
item.description:
My first blog post!

This will primarily be a notebook of my ideas, research and project notes. Usually the subject is PHP and XML.Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala
